intro: Xylopia buxifolia, commonly known as the box-leaf xylopia, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that resemble those of boxwood, hence its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-yellow in color, and it produces woody, aromatic fruits. Xylopia buxifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
